Commentary.ab: yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. zaōtā....mraōtū. yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. yō. zaōtā.... mraōtū] Indian mss. only yaϑā. ahū. vairiiō. yō. zaōtā....mraōtū

Nerangs.ab: pad mān ī ātaxšān āθrō ahurahe mazdå tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdå xšnaōϑra y v x f pad mān ī wehān tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdå xšnaōϑra y v x f

"In the fire temple, (he should recite): āθrō ahurahe mazdå tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdå xšnaōϑra y v x f In the house of the believers, (he should recite): tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdå xšnaōϑra y v x f"

agar ham zōt xwēštan yašt sāxtag bēd yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā frā.mē mrūtē aϑā ratuš aṣ̌āt̰cīt̰ haca frā aṣ̌auua vīδuuå mraōtū agar rāspīg yašt sāxtag bēd zōt yaϑā ahū vairiiō yō zaotā frā.mē mrūtē rāspīg aϑā ratuš haca frā aṣ̌auua vīδuuå mraōtū

"When the zōt himself has prepared the yašt, (then he should recite:) yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā frā.mē mrūtē aϑā ratuš aṣ̌āt̰cīt̰ haca frā aṣ̌auua vīδuuå mraōtū When the rāspīg has prepared the yašt, (then) the zōt (should recite): yaϑā ahū vairiiō yō zaotā frā.mē mrūtē; the rāspīg (should answer): aϑā ratuš haca frā aṣ̌auua vīδuuå mraōtū."

Quotations.ab: frauuarānē mazdaiiasnō gāh ān ī bawēd pad mān ī wehān tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ xšnaōϑra ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay hamē āϑrō ahurahe mazdā̊ puϑra tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ xšnaōϑra ka az ān kē barsom bandēd parāhōm kard wāz dārēd wāz az ōy gīrišn ka nē [[ēn wāzag-ē]] ka az xwēš gīrēd weh-iz ast āzādmard guft hād har yazišn-ē ān xūbtar ka [az] rāspīg ī abēgumān wāz frāz gīrēd ud ātaxšgāh pad pādyāb be kunēd har kē andar ān yazišn kār-ē kāmēd kardan wāz az †ōy gīrēd u-š wāz frāz gīrēd

"(He has to recite:) frauuarānē mazdaiiasnō with the corresponding gāh and, when (the performance) takes place in the house of the good ones, (with the šnūman) tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ xšnaōϑra. There is one who says: "Always (with the šnūman) āϑrō ahurahe mazdā̊ puϑra tauua ātarš puϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ xšnaōϑra". If the (priest) who ties the barsom and prepared the parāhōm holds the wāz, (the zōt) has to take the wāz from him. If not [[this is one uttenrance]], it is indeed better if he takes it from himself. Āzādmard said: "It is best for any yazišn if (the zōt) takes the wāz from a well-qualified rāspīg and (then) purifies the seat of the fire. Any (priest) who desires to officiate at that yazišn takes the wāz from him. He takes the wāz"
čīyōn gōwīhēd pad dēn kū-š pad zāyišn guft kū čīyōn ox kāmag tō kē zōt hē kū pēšōbāy ī dāmān hē frāz ō man gōw kū dastwar bawišn
čīyōn zarduxšt gētīy tanīh rāy gētīy ēwāzīhā guft Ohrmazd mēnōyīhā rāy ā-š pāsox guft kū ēdōn radīhā ēdōn frārōnīhā az ahlȳīh čēgām-iz-ēw frāz ahlawān āgāhīhā gōwam kū-t dastwar hom

As it is said in the dēn that at the time of his birth, Zaraθuštra received from Ohrmazd the authority regarding the dēn. As it is said in the dēn, (Zardušt) said at his birth: “Like the lord’s will you, who are the zōt [that is, you are the pēšōbāy of the creatures], say it to me [that is, you should act as the dastwar].

As Zardušt spoke with material words because of the materiality of his body, thus (spoke) Ohrmazd immaterially because of his immateriality. He answered: “Thus are the rad [thus are the virtuous ones] according to the Order whatever it is, I say it knowingly to the orderly ones [that is, I am the dastwar]

guftan ī zardušt mēnōgīhā pad waγdān garān zāyišn kū-t čīyōn axw kāmag kē zōt hē frāz ō man gōwē ud passox ī az ohrmazd kū ēdōn radīhā az ahlāyīh čēgām-iz-ē frāz ahlaw āgāhīhā gōwam [tō hē frāyiz arztar ud tō ahlawtar ud tō āgāstom ud tō gōwē dēn ī māzdēsnān ō harwispīn dāmān ]

Regarding Zardušt’s words at the time of the difficult birth of his head: “Like the lord’s will you, who are the zōt. Ahura, say it to me. Mazdā answered: “Thus are the rad [thus are the virtuous ones] according to the Order, whatever it is, I, the virtuous one, say it knowingly [you are far more valuable, you are more virtuous and you are the wisest. You announce the dēn to all the creatures].

ab.ab: "The chief priest (zōt) establishes eye contact with his assistant (rāspī") (who continues to occupy the chief priest's seat with his hand on the barsom) and proclaims the first phrase of an antiphonal recitation, called an exchange of bāj ("utterance")."
